ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: â€¢ The Jan Shikshan Sansthan, Bhopal-1 is a NGO sponsored by the Government of India, Ministry of HRD, Department of School education & Literacy, New Delhi â€¢ It gives vocational training in various trades to illiterate, neo-literates and rudimentary level SC, ST, OBC and General Category beneficiaries in accordance with the Annual Action Plan approved by the Government of India, Ministry of HRD, Department of School Education and Literacy, New Delhi. â€¢ Some of the achievements are â€¢ Trained more than 20000 beneficiaries so far. â€¢ Most of the beneficiaries are self employed â€¢ Giving "Akshar Gyan" to illiterate persons. â€¢ Organize "Awareness Programme" - On Women Empowerment, Legal Rights of women, child health, women health, environment, financial literacy, HIV Aids etc. â€¢ Activity - Implementing Programme of Govt. of India - Jan Dhan Yojana, Mudra Loan Yojana, Suraksha Bima Yojana, Saakasharata Mission Swachhata Pakawara, programmes also conducted Nav Saaksharata Mulyankan Pariksha at SAGY Village. â€¢ The JSS Bhopal-1 has been awarded NLM - UNESCO Award - 2011 for outstanding achievements in the field of skill development. The award consisted of a trophy and a certificate. The award was conferred by Her Excellency the President of India on 8th September 2011

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The organization got support from philanthropists and the members of the board. There was some consultancy taken by the board members and that money was put to charity. The organization aims to work for the poor and the under privileged and thus intends to continue the good work with support from different donors.

The purpose of the project is care and protection of children that are in need of care and protection and children who are in conflict with the law. The children are provided with temporary shelter and are restored and reintegrated into their families.

The project is under the child protection scheme of India which comes under the ministry of women and child development department. The aim is to provide protection to children below the age of 18 in difficult circumstance and protect them from violation of their rights

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: KIRTI BALLETE AND PERFORMING ARTS Kirti Ballet and Performing Arts was established in Bhopal (Madhya Pradesh) in 2000. Within short period of a decade of working it earned a name and won laurels for its aesthetic and innovative creation of ballets and other items based on the subject of social concerns and high literary and cultural values from mythology, classics and folk life. The institution is continuously trying to develop art of Ballet and popularize it. The institution organizes workshops, seminars to apprise all sections of society, especially tribal, Dalit and child artists, of the stories full of human spirit and inspiring values. We also train the talents to produce ballets, plays and other cultural items and help stage them. We prepare artists with great emphasis on folk, classical and creative style of dance, drama and music. One section of our institution is engaged in research in the field of literature, history, culture, education and other arts. Information and knowledge gained from research work has been successfully utilized in creations of ballets. Chandra Madhav Barik, the Principal Choreographer is trained by worldwide respected Choreographer late Shri Prabhat Ganguly and Padma Shree Gul Bardhan of Rang Sri Little Ballet Troupe, Bhopal. He has also served them as their Assistant Choreographer in several ballets and worked with many experts of folk styles. He himself is a Chhau expert and creative Choreographer. He has helped several dance and drama directors in conducting their workshops on creative body movements Barik has done many projects with the financial assistance of the State Academy of Arts (M.P) Department of Culture Govt. of India, Sangeet Natak Academy, Delhi, National School of Drama and some NGOs. Beside workshops, his creations include famous ballets Maa (Mother), Rani Awantibai, Aprajita (Draupadi), Alha Nainagarh Ki Larai, Bajirao (Drama), Abhishapt Karn, Chakravyuh, Jhansi Ki Rani. All of his creations have become very popular and appreciated by media. As an artist Mr. Barik worked in almost all ballets produced by Rang Shri Littile Ballet Troupe. He has taken part in Bharat Mahotsava in Russia in 1988 and 2009, Mauritius in 1990 and Thailand in 1995. He has also specialized in Light and Sound System, Redording, Mask making, Painting sets etc. Another main member of the institution is Shruti Kirti who has also been working with Rang Shri Littile Ballet Troupe since 1984. She is post graduate in History and Music (Vocal). She has visited Russia, Mauritius and Thailand as an artist of L.B.T. She is also well versed in all kinds of work relating to ballet mainly Costume designing, Property, Management etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: KSWS has been concentrating in the field of social development by mobilization, empowerment, functionalizing public service delivery systems, community health, education and other associated sectors in the villages and slums. KSWS is blessed with four decades of vast and wide experiences in the field of social development. As result, KSWS has formed 1775 Self Help Groups, 110 Federations of women in 382 villages /slums of Ujjain,Shajapur and Rajgarh districts. .Kripa imparts knowledge to more than nine hundred children through tuition in Non Formal Schools and 50 children through National Child Labour Project (NCLP) School. During the past three years, we have either restored 351 cases or given shelter to children who needed the care and protection. Vocational training was given in the Juvenile justice home. 1635 village women were given Vocational training. 7875 women started and benefited from Income Generation Programmes. Down through these years KSWS has constructed 12 stop dams, dug 86 pond or deepened them, 13000 trenches, 83000 farm bonds, 3000 stone bounds and gulley plugs under the water shed programme.
